npc.speach: Lucius escorts you to courtroom. There is an old man in a long, black robe wielding his gavel with a firm grip. You conclude that he does not seem to be an apporachable person...

npc.name: Magistrate
npc.speach: Lucius is this the man who was asleep when the keeper was killed and the relics were stolen?

npc.name: Lucius
npc.speach: Yes your honor. Xander has neglected his duties as the keeper's body guard by falling asleep instead of being on watch. The evidence I have is that Xander was just alseep and I have dragged him here. The guards with me will testify to that as well.

npc.name: Magistrate
npc.speach: Your argument has been noted Lucius. Now what is your defense Xander?
You begin to panic not knowing you would have to create some defense for yourself. You compose yourself to say the following.

npc.name: Xander
npc.speach: I should not be resonsible for her death even if I fell asleep.
Silence fills the room and the magistrate strokes his beard deliberating in his mind. Seconds of silence becomes minutes as you stand before him waiting his verdict.

npc.name: Magistrate
npc.speach: Your agrument has been noted as well Xander. I have reached a verdict. Xander although your actions were very irresponsible and disgrace the keepers' bodyguards, I will not hold you responsible for the death of the keeper. However, you are to be evicted from this manor as soon as possible.
Lucius bows and then violently evicts Xander from the manor. He brutally escorts him to the door and whispers to Xander.

npc.name: Lucius
npc.speach: If you ever set foot in here again, there won't be a magistrate to protect you.
Lucius throws you onto the dirt and slams the door. There is silence and then you get up and walk towards the town.
